title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION  (UNIVERSITY) CIPH, GREPH

EU.content: Derrida believes in indestructibility of ordered procedures of legitimation, titles, diplomas
EU.linkedContent: Derrida believes in indestructibility of ordered procedures of legitimation, titles, diplomas

EU.content: universitas has essential tie w/ logocentric, onto-encyclopedic system
EU.linkedContent: universitas has essential tie w/ logocentric, onto-encyclopedic system

EU.content: GREPH: urgent, ineluctable task in places we occupy, can’t deny we belong, we’re inscribed
EU.linkedContent: GREPH: urgent, ineluctable task in places we occupy, can’t deny we belong, we’re inscribed

EU.content: GREPH’s activities can’t be separated from larger scene
EU.linkedContent: GREPH’s activities can’t be separated from larger scene

EU.content: political involvement w/ GREPH, publications, even the gesture I make today: make possible involvements/responsibilities in the same struggle (même lutte)
EU.linkedContent: political involvement w/ GREPH, publications, even the gesture I make today: make possible involvements/responsibilities in the same struggle (même lutte)

EU.content: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities
EU.linkedContent: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities

EU.content: provocation to think brings together in same instant desire for memory & exposure to future
EU.linkedContent: provocation to think brings together in same instant desire for memory & exposure to future

EU.content: [re: philosophical institutions vis-à-vis GREPH] profound political mutation, a change of government wouldn’t be enough
EU.linkedContent: [re: philosophical institutions vis-à-vis GREPH] profound political mutation, a change of government wouldn’t be enough

EU.content: philosophy professors resemble each other less any other teacher
EU.linkedContent: philosophy professors resemble each other less any other teacher

EU.content: we need subtle, differentiated work that doesn’t give in to any intimidation
EU.linkedContent: we need subtle, differentiated work that doesn’t give in to any intimidation

EU.content: Derrida mistrusts reactionism against media, says there are not enough media, that the risk w/ media is that it is too monolithic, concentrated, violently uniform
EU.linkedContent: Derrida mistrusts reactionism against media, says there are not enough media, that the risk w/ media is that it is too monolithic, concentrated, violently uniform

EU.content: new philosophical objects, light, permeable, mobile: dispersion, new philosophical “formations”
EU.linkedContent: new philosophical objects, light, permeable, mobile: dispersion, new philosophical “formations”

EU.content: philosophy departments after “end of metaphysics” > return to philosophy not a “return of the repressed”
EU.linkedContent: philosophy departments after “end of metaphysics” > return to philosophy not a “return of the repressed”

EU.content: increased demand for philosophy outside the institution
EU.linkedContent: increased demand for philosophy outside the institution

EU.content: disturbances in theology, law, medicine are calling for philosophy [Kant] > return of philosophy often takes form of new configuration of ethico-juridical problems
EU.linkedContent: disturbances in theology, law, medicine are calling for philosophy [Kant] > return of philosophy often takes form of new configuration of ethico-juridical problems

EU.content: philosophy’s new relation w/ techno-scientific reason: coextensive immediacy w/ encyclopedia
EU.linkedContent: philosophy’s new relation w/ techno-scientific reason: coextensive immediacy w/ encyclopedia

EU.content: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)

EU.content: [on CIPH’s potential]
EU.linkedContent: [on CIPH’s potential]

EU.content: interference of knowledge or “interscience” [Einstein]: prepare or let oneself be surprised > new information & communicative technology, new objects arising on transversal paths
EU.linkedContent: interference of knowledge or “interscience” [Einstein]: prepare or let oneself be surprised > new information & communicative technology, new objects arising on transversal paths

EU.content: privilege accorded to inter-ferences [see p. 207]: transference in every sense of the word
EU.linkedContent: privilege accorded to inter-ferences [see p. 207]: transference in every sense of the word

EU.content: we know how inhospitable research establishment can be to themes/questions that exceed/disorganize general program > theoretic-institutional mobility must be accepted today
EU.linkedContent: we know how inhospitable research establishment can be to themes/questions that exceed/disorganize general program > theoretic-institutional mobility must be accepted today

EU.content: calling for competences that aren’t only theoretical: a know-how, the capacity for performance, that avoids classical institutional calculation > CIPH will encourage “research training,” develop technical competence (database, telematics, “artificial intelligence”) & a new kind of “philosophical” reflection [baby daddy]
EU.linkedContent: calling for competences that aren’t only theoretical: a know-how, the capacity for performance, that avoids classical institutional calculation > CIPH will encourage “research training,” develop technical competence (database, telematics, “artificial intelligence”) & a new kind of “philosophical” reflection [baby daddy]

EU.content: beyond interdisciplinarity
EU.linkedContent: beyond interdisciplinarity

EU.content: [CIPH] external/internal limitrophes > give them a place and opportunity worthy of them: l’exploration aux limites, singular, out-of-ordinary (insolite) incursions, limitrophic or aleatory
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] external/internal limitrophes > give them a place and opportunity worthy of them: l’exploration aux limites, singular, out-of-ordinary (insolite) incursions, limitrophic or aleatory

EU.content: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)
EU.linkedContent: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)

EU.content: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment
EU.linkedContent: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment

EU.content: branch out to Africa, Asia, Latin America > avoid Eurocentrism
EU.linkedContent: branch out to Africa, Asia, Latin America > avoid Eurocentrism

EU.content: [re: CIPH] not a system (ontological ordering), not a doctrine (linked to discourses, pedagogical institutions), not a program (prescriptive, end-oriented [finalisée]) > but not empirical/rhapsodic: a “thinking” of pedagogy, each research group, each “program,” will never renounce precise specificity, autonomy, internal necessity
EU.linkedContent: [re: CIPH] not a system (ontological ordering), not a doctrine (linked to discourses, pedagogical institutions), not a program (prescriptive, end-oriented [finalisée]) > but not empirical/rhapsodic: a “thinking” of pedagogy, each research group, each “program,” will never renounce precise specificity, autonomy, internal necessity

EU.content: “the necessity of these conclusions should be capable of imposing itself on the basis of other premises” [see baby daddy in other works] > mission, envoi, “aim (finalité)”
EU.linkedContent: “the necessity of these conclusions should be capable of imposing itself on the basis of other premises” [see baby daddy in other works] > mission, envoi, “aim (finalité)”

EU.content: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.
EU.linkedContent: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.

EU.content: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma
EU.linkedContent: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma

EU.content: “title,” “category,” “regulating idea,” “problematic,” “working hypothesis,” words to be used as general translation for debates, transversal communications
EU.linkedContent: “title,” “category,” “regulating idea,” “problematic,” “working hypothesis,” words to be used as general translation for debates, transversal communications

EU.content: style of university: pathbreaking, trailblazing (frayage, fléchage)
EU.linkedContent: style of university: pathbreaking, trailblazing (frayage, fléchage)

EU.content: destination not thesis/theme or category > what happens to question “what is?” when it’s measured against destination? > strategic force of this question, “lever,” even polemological: new military-industrial complex strategies should be included/welcomed by CIPH
EU.linkedContent: destination not thesis/theme or category > what happens to question “what is?” when it’s measured against destination? > strategic force of this question, “lever,” even polemological: new military-industrial complex strategies should be included/welcomed by CIPH

EU.content: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes
EU.linkedContent: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes

EU.content: differance as sendoff, tele- and trans-ference
EU.linkedContent: differance as sendoff, tele- and trans-ference

EU.content: [re: nonsynonymous synonyms] all these indices should be multiplied
EU.linkedContent: [re: nonsynonymous synonyms] all these indices should be multiplied

EU.content: Derrida declares limits in order to lift/distance/disappropriate them [Rousseau describes doesn’t declare]
EU.linkedContent: Derrida declares limits in order to lift/distance/disappropriate them [Rousseau describes doesn’t declare]

EU.content: [re: CIPH] against pyramidal hierarchy [height?], for horizontality
EU.linkedContent: [re: CIPH] against pyramidal hierarchy [height?], for horizontality

EU.content: CIPH should question motifs of “depth,” “foundation,” “reason (Grund),” distinguish between “basic (fondamentale)” and “end-oriented (finalisée)” research [see p. 227]
EU.linkedContent: CIPH should question motifs of “depth,” “foundation,” “reason (Grund),” distinguish between “basic (fondamentale)” and “end-oriented (finalisée)” research [see p. 227]

EU.content: “as if” structure—characterizes every philosophical, scientific institution worthy of the name
EU.linkedContent: “as if” structure—characterizes every philosophical, scientific institution worthy of the name

EU.content: Derrida will now introduce points of order as a broad introduction, a four-year “translation” > points of order or points of pause (points d’orgue): rhythms, pauses, insistences
EU.linkedContent: Derrida will now introduce points of order as a broad introduction, a four-year “translation” > points of order or points of pause (points d’orgue): rhythms, pauses, insistences

EU.content: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] “basic,” “fundamental” research should cease being ashamed of itself [due to pressure from sciences, especially social sciences], research the “basic” around series gift/destination w/out returning to hegemonic structure > a “scheme” that never becomes “program” or obligatory “theme”

EU.content: end and ends, limits, borders: always topoi of vigilant reflection for CIPH > CIPH shouldn’t treat its destination, legitimation, secondarily > who wouldn’t want CIPH to one day have richness and vitality we foresee, new apparatus, obligating many other instances to reckon w/ it
EU.linkedContent: end and ends, limits, borders: always topoi of vigilant reflection for CIPH > CIPH shouldn’t treat its destination, legitimation, secondarily > who wouldn’t want CIPH to one day have richness and vitality we foresee, new apparatus, obligating many other instances to reckon w/ it

EU.content: most ruthless critique still produced in name of a system of legitimation—one can at most deny this, it’s the most common thing in the world today
EU.linkedContent: most ruthless critique still produced in name of a system of legitimation—one can at most deny this, it’s the most common thing in the world today

EU.content: [Derrida offers an example of what “fundamental” research of Heidegger might look like]
EU.linkedContent: [Derrida offers an example of what “fundamental” research of Heidegger might look like]

EU.content: Derrida suggests necessity of homogenous translations of Freud, Wittgenstein, Heidegger
EU.linkedContent: Derrida suggests necessity of homogenous translations of Freud, Wittgenstein, Heidegger

EU.content: [re: CIPH] reactualizing categories said to be classical by adjusting them to new objects
EU.linkedContent: [re: CIPH] reactualizing categories said to be classical by adjusting them to new objects

EU.content: implication/engagement as something other than epistemological “philosophical decisions,” possibility of opening, orienting new scientific spaces
EU.linkedContent: implication/engagement as something other than epistemological “philosophical decisions,” possibility of opening, orienting new scientific spaces

EU.content: [points of pause for CIPH] general deontology (access to birth control), call for interpretation, taking sides, psychoanalysis, law (eloquence in favor of human rights, though necessary, is not philosophy), police (self-guided missiles, problems of sendoff) language: all destinal significations that transmit, emit…linguistics, semiotics, intersemiotic functionings (speech & gesture, art w/ multiple inscriptions), is thought of language opened/inhibited by philosophy?, pragmatism > telecommunicatons not one mode of technology among others (spacing of destination), new techniques, data banks—book, computer science, poietics: theory & performative
EU.linkedContent: [points of pause for CIPH] general deontology (access to birth control), call for interpretation, taking sides, psychoanalysis, law (eloquence in favor of human rights, though necessary, is not philosophy), police (self-guided missiles, problems of sendoff) language: all destinal significations that transmit, emit…linguistics, semiotics, intersemiotic functionings (speech & gesture, art w/ multiple inscriptions), is thought of language opened/inhibited by philosophy?, pragmatism > telecommunicatons not one mode of technology among others (spacing of destination), new techniques, data banks—book, computer science, poietics: theory & performative

EU.content: translation: transferential, diagonal, transversal, interscientific research
EU.linkedContent: translation: transferential, diagonal, transversal, interscientific research

EU.content: continental quasi-incommunicability reconstituted w/in each country > international college, CIPH, should transform this “babelization”: philosophical “transcontinentality”
EU.linkedContent: continental quasi-incommunicability reconstituted w/in each country > international college, CIPH, should transform this “babelization”: philosophical “transcontinentality”

EU.content: analyses and interpretation (of these conflictual fields) calls for action
EU.linkedContent: analyses and interpretation (of these conflictual fields) calls for action
